title: Fragmentary Ointment Jar Inscribed for Unas
description:
One cylindrical alabaster vessel with flat top. Flaring rim and base. Inscribed for the Horus Wadj-tawy the Nsw-bity, Unas. 
Condition: The rear of the vessel is completely broken off—almost down to the bottom.  Front edge of the foot is much chipped.
dimensions: 3 5/16 in. (8.4 cm) high x 3 1/2 in. (8.9 cm) diameter
inscribed: Inscribed for Horus Wadj-tawy the Nsw-bity, Unas

museum_location.name: This item is not on view

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.title: 37.76E
labels.content: Egyptian cleansing materials made the skin very dry, especially in the desert climate. Most Egyptians who could afford it followed daily washing with ointments rubbed into the skin. These ointments were often scented.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art

exhibitions.title: To Live Forever: Egyptian Treasures from the Brooklyn Museum
